item.description:
Date: Feb 2, 2009
Time: 7 pm - 9 pm
Location: Desera Interactive (Somerville, near Porter Square)

This advanced-beginner program assumes participants have basic knowledge of Photoshop. The demonstration will cover techniques for processing great black and white images using a digital workflow.

- Photograph for black and white using a color digital camera. Filters, exposure compensation, and bracketing techniques will be discussed.

- Convert the RGB color information to a great B&W image using the Photoshop techniques including the Channel Mixer, CS3 black and white filter, luminosity blending, and LAB mode

- Understand the histogram and make proper tonal adjustments using levels and curves

- Use masks and dodge/burn tools to complete nondestructive edits to different zones in the image.

- Learn the basics of how print drivers, ink, and paper affect the final output

The location is on Somerville Ave near Porter Square. On street parking is available, and the office is an easy 5-10 minute walk from the red line T-stop. Please submit the $20 fee when you RSVP using the Paypal link, or contact the organizer if you prefer to pay by check. If you need to cancel, refunds will be issued up to 5 days before the event if you cancel for any reason. Refunds will be issued after that if the program fills up and someone else takes your spot. All participants will receive a refund if the event is canceled by the organizer.

Computers are not available in the conference room, but all participants will receive a detailed booklet of the information covered, and practice tutorials and files on a CD-R to try at home.

group.name: The Boston Digital Arts Meetup Group

item.name: Lecture Series: Digital Black & White
